title: British Politics Is Working Too Well
text:
Conventional wisdom holds that the United Kingdom is in the throes of a messy political collapse as Brexit debates grind on and it becomes harder to tell who’s in charge, let alone what’s coming next. Conventional wisdom, as usual, is wrong. Britain’s problem is that its political system is working too well.

You’d be forgiven some skepticism. This week’s main development is that Parliament no longer even knows when it’s open. Prime Minister Boris Johnson attempted earlier this month to prorogue the legislature for approximately...
description: Free states don’t act on small majorities. They ask what voters really want and build broad support.
